greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: GCD of consecutive members of the EKG sequence A064413.
comment: All terms shown are prime powers, but this does not hold for all n. For n > 2, a(n) is divisible by A064740(n).
The GCD of A064413(578)=620 and A064413(579)=610 is 10. This is the first time the GCD is not a prime-power. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 30 2015
a(A064955(n)) = A000040(n) for n > 1. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 17 2001]
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..1000
J. C. Lagarias, E. M. Rains and N. J. A. Sloane, The EKG sequence, Exper. Math. 11 (2002), 437-446.
Index entries for sequences related to EKG sequence
mathematica: t = {1, 2}; Join[{1}, Table[k = 3; While[MemberQ[t, k] || (y = GCD[Last[t], k]) == 1, k++];AppendTo[t, k]; y, {91}]] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 09 2013 *)
program: a073734_list = zipWith gcd a064413_list $ tail a064413_list
results.author: _David Wasserman_, Aug 06 2002
